sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten postcard from Weisse to Schenker, undated [December 24?, 1913?]
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Photograph of Hans Weisse with inscription..
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Bild; photograph; Dank; thanks

tei:opener.tei:note: photograph of Hans Weisse gazing at a framed portrait of Johannes Brahms, photographer: Franz Hofer, Bad Ischl

tei:div.tei:p: Fassen Sie, lieber Meister,OJ 15/15, [M] is only a photocopy; the original postcard, with inscription, is preserved under "Photographs and Other Portraits" at OJ 72/24, No. 1. It is entirely undated, except for the implication of "Merry Christmas!" The photocopy is annotated (possibly in the hand of Oswald Jonas) "undated [1913?]." Schenker's diary for December 24, 1913 states: "Christmas presents received only from Mrs. Deutsch, Irene Mayerhofer, Weisse, Brünauer, Floriz and Fanny Violin," followed on December 26 by "Letters of thanks to Mrs. Deutsch and Weisse." In the surrounding years, the diary for December 24, 1912 reads: "Weisse brings a present in the morning, and cancels for the afternoon," and for December 24, 1914 reads: "Weisse, with an exuberant letter of gratitude, presents me with photographs of the autograph manuscript of the Brahms intermezzos ." Either of these alternative years, or others, could be the year of this postcard. das obige Bild symbolisirt auf, und nehmen Sie es als bescheidenen Dank dafür, dass Sie mich sehend machten!

tei:opener.tei:note: photograph of Hans Weisse gazing at a framed portrait of Johannes Brahms, photographer: Franz Hofer, Bad Ischl

tei:div.tei:p: Conceive of the above photograph symbolically, dear Master, and accept it as humble thanks for your having opened my eyes!
